docs.snippet: Mr. Lake was instrumental in founding the band King Crimson, which is widely regarded as having produced the first progressive-rock album.

headline.print_headline: Greg Lake, a Progressive-Rock Icon of King Crimson Fame, Dies at 69
headline.main: Greg Lake, of King Crimson and Emerson, Lake and Palmer, Dies at 69

docs.abstract: Greg Lake, singer, musician and songwriter credited with releasing first progressive rock album as founding member of band King Crimson, dies at age 69.

docs.snippet: A prominent anti-Muslim group of Buddhist nationalists in Myanmar is criticizing former U.N. Secretary-General Kofi Annan on social media, and accidentally taking actor Morgan Freeman down with him.

headline.print_headline: Myanmar Group Targets Kofi Annan; Uses Morgan Freeman Photo
headline.main: Myanmar Group Targets Kofi Annan; Uses Morgan Freeman Photo

docs.snippet: Uzbekistan's prime minister led the nation's Independence Day celebration Wednesday in the capital of Tashkent as President Islam Karimov remained hospitalized.

headline.print_headline: Uzbek PM Leads National Celebration; President Still Ill
headline.main: Uzbek PM Leads National Celebration; President Still Ill

docs.snippet: Ms. Vardalos is appearing at the Public Theater in “Tiny Beautiful Things” portraying Sugar, an advice columnist eventually revealed to be Ms. Strayed.

docs.snippet: Singapore posted new public speaking rules on Friday, clarifying that foreign companies and individuals need a permit to sponsor or take part in certain events, in an amendment that will restrict foreign support for an annual gay-rights gathering.

headline.print_headline: Singapore Says Foreigners Need Permit for Public Assemblies
headline.main: Singapore Says Foreigners Need Permit for Public Assemblies

docs.snippet: Two decades after leaving his village in Italy’s Alto Molise region, Giuseppe Nucci returned to photograph local traditions and rituals before they disappeared.
docs.abstract: Two decades after leaving his village in Italy’s Alto Molise region, Giuseppe Nucci returned to photograph local traditions and rituals before they disappeared.

docs.snippet: The historic Monza circuit is to stay on the Formula One calendar after agreeing a new deal with the sport’s organizers, Italian officials said on Wednesday.    The circuit near Milan has been on the calendar every year bar one since the cha...

headline.print_headline: Monza to Keep Formula One Race: Government Officials
headline.main: Monza to Keep Formula One Race: Government Officials

docs.snippet: Two tigers and a bear named Baloo started a new life in a wildlife reserve in northern Jordan on Sunday.

headline.print_headline: Rescued Tigers, Bear Get New Life in Jordan Wildlife Refuge
